title: Are 11th grade marks important while applying to UK colleges? - Quora
tags: Colleges and Universities in the United Kingdom

response.answer_text: If by “College”, you mean “University”, then our universities are only really interested in A level or IB results, both of which are exams taken at age 18. They will consider the American “Grades” systems, but it’s best to contact the particular university you’re interested in for details. And no, our universities generally can’t care less about “extra curriculars”.

Grades, or marks, are always important when applying to colleges; however, other factors such as test scores, extra-curriculars, and letters of recommendation also play a role in the application process. Take a look at the college that you are looking to apply for by looking at their website and/or contacting their admissions department to determine what aspects that specific college finds “most important.”
